instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message:
liquid damaged board. someone attempted repair this board, backlight driver is missing and has been ultrasoniced :(

green then orange light on magsafe 2 (genuine adapter), no fan spin, CPU does get little warm after a while.

- PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 16.66v
- PPBUS_g3H = 8,58V
- PP3V42_G3h = 3,41V
- PPV5_S5 = 5V
- PP3V3_S0 = 0.724V
- PP3v3 = 3,3V
- PP3V3_S3 = 0V
- PPVCC_S0_CPU = 0V
- PPVRTC_G3H = 3.294v
- PM_SLP_S3_L = 0.001V
- PM_SLP_S4_L = 0.001V
- PM_SLP_S5_L = 0.001V
- SMC_LID = 3.4v
- SMC_RESET_L = 3.4v
- PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.429v

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message: How do traces between SPI ROM resistors look?

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message: i cant tell if these chips has been replaced or just rework.

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message: You can clearly see the solder blobs on some traces. Could be anything at this point, rabbit hole board that has been messed with, worst case.

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message: the solder blobs on some traces are not shorted. should i leave this board?

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message: No they are not shorted. It does mean someone fucked with it and gave up. At this point there is no telling what happened to the board. Only continue with this if you have nothing better to do.

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message:
PP5V_S0 is missing.
PP5V_S4RS3 is missing

U8080 create PP5V_S0


what create PP5V_S4RS3 ?


U7501 create P5VS4RS3_EN_R

P5VS4RS3_EN_R is 0v

pin14, pin29 of U7501 is 5v


bad U7501?

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message: Why would U7501 generate its own enable. PM_SLP_S4_L is missing which is worst case. Check RTC voltages

threads.title: 820-3437 not turning on
threads.message:
U1900

pin1 = 3.294v
pin2 = 3.294v
pin12 = 0.391v
pin13= 3.432v


Y1905

pin1 = 1.005v
pin3 = 1.265v


i dont have a oliscope.



0v on PM_PCH_PWROK, SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD

threads.message: Look at Louis's latest video on that 00165 board. This board is kinda the same caliber.

threads.message: Save yourself two hours, fast forward to 1:59:30 and do that part now. [url]https://youtu.be/rvrCSntnhyM?t=7191[/url]
